tests.title: A conforming document MUST be secured by at least one securing mechanism as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms.

cell.rowId: A conforming document MUST be secured by at least one securing mechanism as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms.

tests.title: A conforming issuer implementation produces conforming documents, MUST include all required properties in the conforming documents that it produces, and MUST secure the conforming documents it produces using a securing mechanism as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms.

cell.rowId: A conforming issuer implementation produces conforming documents, MUST include all required properties in the conforming documents that it produces, and MUST secure the conforming documents it produces using a securing mechanism as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms.

tests.title: A conforming verifier implementation consumes conforming documents, MUST perform verification on a conforming document as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms, MUST check that each required property satisfies the normative requirements for that property, and MUST produce errors when non-conforming documents are detected.

cell.rowId: A conforming verifier implementation consumes conforming documents, MUST perform verification on a conforming document as described in Section 4.9 Securing Mechanisms, MUST check that each required property satisfies the normative requirements for that property, and MUST produce errors when non-conforming documents are detected.

tests.title: JSON-LD-based processors MUST produce an error when a JSON-LD context redefines any term in the active context.

cell.rowId: JSON-LD-based processors MUST produce an error when a JSON-LD context redefines any term in the active context.

tests.title: The value of the credentialSchema property MUST be one or more data schemas that provide verifiers with enough information to determine whether the provided data conforms to the provided schema(s).

cell.rowId: The value of the credentialSchema property MUST be one or more data schemas that provide verifiers with enough information to determine whether the provided data conforms to the provided schema(s).

tests.title: Each credentialSchema MUST specify its type (for example, JsonSchemaValidator2018), and an id property.

cell.rowId: Each credentialSchema MUST specify its type (for example, JsonSchemaValidator2018), and an id property.

tests.title: credentialSchema id MUST be a URL identifying the schema file.

cell.rowId: credentialSchema id MUST be a URL identifying the schema file.

tests.title: The value of the refreshService property MUST be one or more refresh services that provides enough information to the recipient's software such that the recipient can refresh the verifiable credential.
Each refreshService value MUST specify its type (for example, ManualRefreshService2018) and its id, which is the URL of the service.
The value of the termsOfUse property MUST specify one or more terms of use policies under which the creator issued the credential or presentation.

cell.rowId: The value of the termsOfUse property MUST specify one or more terms of use policies under which the creator issued the credential or presentation.

tests.title: Each termsOfUse value MUST specify its type, for example, IssuerPolicy, and MAY specify its instance id.

cell.rowId: Each termsOfUse value MUST specify its type, for example, IssuerPolicy, and MAY specify its instance id.

tests.title: The value of the evidence property MUST be one or more evidence schemes providing enough information for a verifier to determine whether the evidence gathered by the issuer meets its confidence requirements for relying on the credential.

cell.rowId: The value of the evidence property MUST be one or more evidence schemes providing enough information for a verifier to determine whether the evidence gathered by the issuer meets its confidence requirements for relying on the credential.

tests.title: (ZKP) The verifiable credential MUST contain a Proof, using the proof property, so that the holder can derive a verifiable presentation that reveals only the information than the holder intends to reveal.

(ZKP) If a credential definition is being used, the credential definition MUST be defined in the credentialSchema property, so that it can be used by all parties to perform various cryptographic operations in zero-knowledge.

(ZKP) Each derived verifiable credential within a verifiable presentation MUST contain all information necessary to verify the verifiable credential, either by including it directly within the credential, or by referencing the necessary information.
A verifiable presentation MUST NOT leak information that would enable the verifier to correlate the holder across multiple verifiable presentations.
Data model mapping property values to JSON types (not numeric/boolean/sequence/ordered-set/set/empty): "Other values MUST be represented as a String type."
